activities:
The types of personal information received from the EU and/or Switzerland may include, but are not limited to: name, title, company name, physical address, e-mail address, telephone number, credit card information, and username and password.

Red Hat also receives personal information from its employees and job applicants in the EU and/or Switzerland, including, but not limited to: name, home address, telephone number, national identification number, health information, background information, spousal and dependent information, bank account numbers, salary, job title and Curriculum Vitae.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources Data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
